data.title: Football Scores
data.solution:
# Get number of results
n = int(input())

# Map for storing teams and points
teams_map = {}
for i in range(n):
    result = input()

    # Split the result
    teams , score = result.split(":")
    team1 , team2 = teams.split(" vs. ")
    score1 , score2 = map(int,score.split("-"))

    # Add to map if not already in it
    if team1 not in teams_map:
        teams_map[team1] = 0
    if team2 not in teams_map:
        teams_map[team2] = 0

    # Add correct points
    if score1 > score2:
        teams_map[team1] += 3
    elif score2 > score1:
        teams_map[team2] += 3
    else:
        teams_map[team1] += 1
        teams_map[team2] += 1

# Sort by decreasing score and increasing alphabetical order for the team names.
teams = list(teams_map.items())
teams.sort(key = lambda x : (-x[1] , x[0]) )

for name,_ in teams:
    print(name)
data.statement:
Given a series of [[n]] football match results, you must determine and output the final standings. The final standings list teams [[names]] in order from <<MOST>> points to <<LEAST>> points. If two or more teams have equal points, they should be sorted in <<alphabetical order>>.

<<Results>>
Match results are provided in the following format: <<Team A>> vs. <<Team B>>:<<x-y>>
• <<Team A>> and <<Team B>> are the [[names]] of the respective teams.
• <<x>> is the number of goals scored for team <<A>>
• <<y>> is the number of goals scored for team <<B>>.
Teams <<CAN>> play each other more than once in a season.

<<Points>>
If team A scores <<MORE>> goals than team B, team A will win the match and gain {{3}} points, while team B get {{0}} points.
If team A and team B score <<THE SAME>> number of goals, the match is a draw and <<BOTH>> teams will gain {{1}} point.

<<Example>>
Manchester United vs. Arsenal F.C.:0-3
Team A = Manchester United
Team B = Arsenal F.C.
Manchester United scored 0 goals
Arsenal F.C. scored 3 goals
Since Arsenal F.C. scored more goals, they won the match and received {{3}} points. Manchester United received {{0}} points.

testCases.testIn:
3

West Ham vs. Arsenal F.C.:1-6
West Ham vs. Manchester United:1-0

West Ham
Manchester United

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read result:string(256)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1: >> Integer [[n]] representing the number of game results.
<<Next [[n]] Lines: >> String representing a game result.
data.outputDescription: <<[[n]] Lines: >> Strings representing the [[names]] of a team from most points to least.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a series of n football match results, you must determine and output the final standings. The final standings list teams names in order from MOST points to LEAST points. If two or more teams have equal points, they should be sorted in alphabetical order.

Results
Match results are provided in the following format: Team A vs. Team B:x-y
• Team A and Team B are the names of the respective teams.
• x is the number of goals scored for team A
• y is the number of goals scored for team B.
Teams CAN play each other more than once in a season.

Points
If team A scores MORE goals than team B, team A will win the match and gain 3 points, while team B get 0 points.
If team A and team B score THE SAME number of goals, the match is a draw and BOTH teams will gain 1 point.

Example
Manchester United vs. Arsenal F.C.:0-3
Team A = Manchester United
Team B = Arsenal F.C.
Manchester United scored 0 goals
Arsenal F.C. scored 3 goals
Since Arsenal F.C. scored more goals, they won the match and received 3 points. Manchester United received 0 points.
Input
Line 1: Integer n representing the number of game results.
Next n Lines: String representing a game result.
Output
n Lines: Strings representing the names of a team from most points to least.
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 100
Example
Input
3
Manchester United vs. Arsenal F.C.:0-3
West Ham vs. Arsenal F.C.:1-6
West Ham vs. Manchester United:1-0
Output
Arsenal F.C.
West Ham
Manchester United
